content:
the Dinkytown shop would be the first in the Twin Cities

by  Layna DarlingPublished  September  

Tim Hortons a popular Canadabased doughnut and coffee chain is set to open a new shop in Dinkytown PERIOD

Steve Young who owns the divided building where SssdudeNutz and the nowclosed Brueggers Bagels are located said Tim Hortons signed a lease in the Dinkytown area but would not comment on the specific location.The Star Tribune reported that the restaurant is expected toopen in the fall PERIOD

University of Minnesota alum and SssdudeNutz coowner Bradley Taylor said a demolition architect inspecting the space next door first told him about the new chain PERIOD

I was a little taken aback Taylor said PERIOD All I can do is keep doing me and just see what happens. tim Hortons has about  restaurants in Canada and  in the United States PERIOD While both businesses offer doughnuts Tim Hortons offers a full menu with sandwiches and soups PERIOD SssdudeNutz offers specialty doughnuts featuring candy bar cookie and cereal pieces PERIOD

The chain has also signed a deal with Bloomingtonbased Restaurant Development Partners to start franchises in Minnesota the Star Tribune reported PERIOD And according to the MinneapolisSt PERIOD Paul Business Journal the chain plans to add a shop in Brooklyn Park PERIOD
